meanings.definition: The state or quality of being noisy.
meanings.sent1: The noisinesses of the construction site made it hard to concentrate.
meanings.sent2: The children's noisinesses filled the playground with laughter and chatter.
meanings.sent3: The noisinesses of the barking dog woke up the entire neighborhood.
meanings.sent4: The noisinesses of the bustling city streets were like a symphony of chaos.
meanings.sent5: The noisinesses of the thunderstorm shook the windows and rattled the doors.

meanings.definition: The tendency to make loud or disruptive sounds.
meanings.sent1: Her noisinesses during the movie annoyed the other viewers.
meanings.sent2: The noisinesses of the fireworks could be heard for miles around.
meanings.sent3: The noisinesses of the alarm clock made it impossible to oversleep.
meanings.sent4: The noisinesses of the car engine sounded like a roaring beast.
meanings.sent5: The noisinesses of the wind howling outside kept everyone awake at night.
